Class Player

java.lang.Object
com.dnikitin.poker.model.Player
public class Player extends Object
Represents the mutable state of a participant in the game session.

Domain Model: This class ensures internal consistency of the player state, such as:

  • Chips cannot be negative.
  • Status transitions (e.g., ACTIVE -> ALL_IN).
  • Hand management.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String id, String name, int startingChips)
      Creates a new player with an initial balance.
      Parameters:
      id - Unique identifier.
      name - Display name.
      startingChips - Initial amount of chips.

  • Method Details

    • receiveCards

      public void receiveCards(List<Card> cards)
      Adds a list of cards to the player's hand. Used during the initial deal and after drawing cards.
      Parameters:
      cards - The list of cards to add.

    • bet

      public void bet(int betAmount)
      Places a bet by moving chips from the balance to the current bet.
      Parameters:
      betAmount - The amount of chips to bet.
      Throws:
      NotEnoughChipsException - if the player does not have enough chips.

    • discardCards

      public void discardCards(List<Integer> indexes)
      Removes cards from the player's hand based on their indexes.

      This method sorts the provided indexes in descending order before removal to prevent index shifting issues (removing a lower index first would shift subsequent elements, invalidating higher indexes).

      Parameters:
      indexes - A list of zero-based indexes of cards to discard.

    • winChips

      public void winChips(int amount)
      Adds chips to the player's balance. Typically called when the player wins a pot.
      Parameters:
      amount - The amount of chips won.

    • fold

      public void fold()
      Marks the player as folded. A folded player cannot participate in further betting or the showdown.

    • resetRoundBet

      public void resetRoundBet()
      Resets the betting state for a new betting round.

      This sets currentBet to 0 but preserves the folded status and the hand, as the game hand is not yet over.

    • clearHand

      public void clearHand()
      Clears the player's hand and resets status for a completely new game hand.

      This removes all cards and sets folded to false. Should be called when the game moves from FINISHED back to ANTE/DEALING.

    • isActive

      public boolean isActive()
      Checks if the player is still active in the current hand.
      Returns:
      true if the player has not folded and has chips remaining; false otherwise.

    • isAllIn

      public boolean isAllIn()
      Checks if the player is all-in.
      Returns:
      true if the player has no chips left but is still in the hand

    • setSittingOut

      public void setSittingOut()
      Sets the player status to sitting out.

    • canAct

      public boolean canAct()
      Checks if the player can act (not folded and not all-in).
      Returns:
      true if the player can make actions
